lead_paragraph: The Film Society of Lincoln Center is presenting a weeklong series, “An Early Clue to the New Direction,” focusing on old movies with gay themes.

headline.print_headline: Sly Winks and Cryptic Clues: Gay Films Before Stonewall
headline.main: Critic’s Notebook: Looking at Gay Movies Before Stonewall

snippet: The Film Society of Lincoln Center is presenting a weeklong series, “An Early Clue to the New Direction,” focusing on old movies with gay themes.
abstract: Wesley Morris Critic's Notebook highlights An Early Clue to the New Direction: Queer Cinema Before Stonewall, weeklong series at Film Society of Lincoln Center; says selections remind viewer of struggles of sin, shame and self-discovery that preceded historic gay rights uprising.
